alert.note: Alert for Western Loudoun (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 29 at 4:32AM EST until January 30 at 1:55PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Maryland... Virginia... Potomac River at Point of Rocks affecting Frederick MD and Western Loudoun zones. Potomac River at Edwards Ferry affecting Eastern Loudoun, Western Loudoun and Northwest Montgomery zones. For the Potomac River...including Paw Paw, Hancock, Shepherdstown, Harpers Ferry, Point of Rocks, Edwards Ferry, Little Falls... flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON. HAS BEEN REPLACED WITH A RIVER FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Potomac River at Point of Rocks. * WHEN...From late tonight to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, The parking lots at both the McKimmey and Brunswick boat ramps begin to flood. Flooding of an agricultural field adjacent to the McKimmey boat ramp is occurring. About half the lower parking lot of the Point of Rocks boat ramp is also flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 9.0 feet, or 7.0 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late tonight. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1245 PM EST.
